annotation.p: A collection of contemplative poems exploring themes of nature, love, and the human condition.

stanza.v: Upon the grass, the dewdrops lie,
Like diamonds scattered from the sky.
Each tiny sphere reflects the dawn,
A fleeting beauty, soon to be gone.
The sun ascends with golden ray,
And melts the jewels of the day.
Yet in that moment, brief and true,
We glimpse eternity in morning dew.

epigraph.p: "Trees are poems that the earth writes upon the sky."

stanza.v: Roots deep in earth's embrace,
Branches reaching heaven's grace.
Centuries whisper through your leaves,
Stories that the forest weaves.
Through storms and sun, you stand so tall,
Witnessing the rise and fall.
Your wisdom carved in rings of time,
A silent teacher, so sublime.
Flow, gentle river, to the sea,
Carry dreams and memories.
Over stones and through the vale,
Tell the mountains' ancient tale.
Your current knows no rest or pause,
Following nature's timeless laws.
In your depths, reflections dance—
Clouds and sky in fleeting glance.
Teach us, river, how to flow,
To let go of all we know.
To journey onward, bend and curve,
With grace and purpose, truth to serve.

title.p: Part II: Matters of the Heart

stanza.v: In quiet moments, soft and still,
Your voice echoes against my will.
A whisper carried on the breeze,
A memory among the trees.
Though miles may stretch between our hands,
Love knows no distance, understands.
In every sunset's golden hue,
I find my way back home to you.
Alone, but not in loneliness,
I walk this path in quietness.
The world recedes, and in its place,
I find myself—a sacred space.
No noise to drown the inner voice,
In silence, I can make my choice.
To know myself, both dark and light,
To hold my truth with gentle might.
For solitude is not a curse,
But time to wander the universe
Within—a journey all my own,
Where seeds of wisdom can be sown.
Life is not a destination,
But a winding, turning road.
Each step a small creation,
Each choice a different load.
Sometimes the path is clear and bright,
Sometimes obscured by fog and fear.
Yet still we walk from dark to light,
Trusting dawn will soon appear.
And when at last our journey ends,
May we look back with no regret.
For life's not measured by its trends,
But by the love we won't forget.
